Articles.Content: I'm thrilled that they are back but that maintenance seemed a lot longer than normal maintenance takes. Anybody know why it was down so long? Don't get me wrong, I'm not complaining. Squad did what they had to do. Now that they are back, we can all be happy and thank them for a job well done. I'm just curious about the time it took. If anyone has theories or if someone from Squad cares to enlighten us, feel free. I am just curious about what all went in to this marathon maintenance the forums underwent (Aside from the obvious that is fixed editor buttons, THANKS SQUAD!).
It was not only maintenance, SQUAD also moved the forum over to a new (faster) server.

I'm just curious about the time it took. If anyone has theories or if someone from Squad cares to enlighten us, feel free. I am just curious about what all went in to this marathon maintenance the forums underwent (Aside from the obvious that is fixed editor buttons, THANKS SQUAD!).

I'm curious what makes you so curious.
Did take a very long time, but if it can help stop outages in the future I'm all for it.

Hey guys, we migrated to a bigger, faster server after realizing the forums were starting to get a bit sluggish and unreliable. The migration took a bit longer than expected, and after our forums came back up, we had a hacktivist group redirect them to their site.

We took everything down and curated the site in a matter of minutes, but we spent some time making sure that everything was squeaky clean and that nothing had been compromised before reinforcing our security and putting the forums back online.

We're terribly sorry for the inconvenience, but also happy to report no data was compromised whatsoever.
Thanks Max! Glad to see that Squad wants the users to have the best experience possible.
I can't guess what a "hacktivist" group could have against this forum. Anyways, I'm glad it's all solved happily
